New Records: Freddie Freeman hit a home run in every World Series game this series
Anthony Volpe hit a go-ahead grand slam
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam in the bottom of the third to make it 5-2
Gleyber Torres hit a three-run homer in the bottom of the eighth to extend New York's lead to 10-4
Aaron Judge recorded his first RBI of the series
Pre-Game Insights: No MLB club has ever come back from a 3-0 series deficit in the World Series, but the Yankees are still alive.
The Yankees will have to make history if they are to shock the Los Angeles Dodgers.
The Dodgers went with a bullpen game for Game 4.
Post-Match Reflections: For us, we're out here trying to make history right now. We know it's never been done, a 3-0 comeback.
Aaron Judge has joined in on the Yankees' offensive outburst.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Volpe helped tack on an insurance run by stretching a single into a double, stealing third and beating the throw home on a fielder's choice attempt at the plate for a 7-4 lead.
Landon Knack tossed a perfect seventh inning against the heart of the Yankees' lineup to prevent them from adding to their 6-4 lead.
Others: The Dodgers failed to break out the brooms in the Bronx on Tuesday.
The Yankees avoided a sweep Tuesday as their offense finally came alive.
